title: 113_hr4469
content: The "Cut Taxes for the Middle Class Act of 2014" includes provisions for state and local sales tax deduction, education tax benefits, and benefits for members of the armed forces. The "Cut Taxes for the Middle Class Act of 2014" includes extensions of housing allowance exclusion, employer wage credit for active duty members, work opportunity tax credit, new markets tax credit, and research credit. It also extends the deduction of state and local general sales taxes. The "Cut Taxes for the Middle Class Act of 2014" extends the deduction of state and local general sales taxes to January 1, 2015, and the above-the-line deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses to December 31, 2014. It also extends the deduction for certain expenses of elementary and secondary school teachers. The "Cut Taxes for the Middle Class Act of 2014" extends deductions for state and local general sales taxes, tuition expenses, and teacher expenses. Additionally, it amends the Housing Assistance Tax Act of 2008 to extend the housing allowance exclusion until January 1, 2015. The "Cut Taxes for the Middle Class Act of 2014" extends various tax credits for businesses, including the employer wage credit for active duty members of the uniformed services, work opportunity tax credit, and new markets tax credit. These extensions apply to payments made after December 31, 2013, and individuals who begin work for the employer after the same date. SEC. 402 extends the new markets tax credit to include 2014 and amends the carryover of unused limitation to apply until 2019. The effective date for these amendments is for calendar years starting after December 31, 2013. SEC. 403 extends and modifies the research credit by changing the deadline from December 31, 2013, to December 31, 2014. The amendments apply to expenses incurred after December 31, 2013.
